ai-thag2.45:1.1_0: One should not suspend others from the Saṅgha, nor raise objections against them;
ai-thag2.45:1.2_0: and neither disparage nor raise one’s voice against one who has crossed to the further shore.
ai-thag2.45:1.3_0: One should not praise oneself among the assemblies,
ai-thag2.45:1.4_0: but be stable, measured in speech, and true to your vows.
ai-thag2.45:2.1_0: For one who sees the meaning so very subtle and fine,
ai-thag2.45:2.2_0: who is skilled in thought and humble in manner;
ai-thag2.45:2.4_0: for extinguishment is hard to find.”
